title: Provides that the state office for the aging shall be deemed a consumer directed personal assistance service provider
summary: Permits the office for the aging to contract for consumer directed personal assistance services through specifically defined models.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K

                                         1701

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 11, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced by M. of A. DINOWITZ, ENGLEBRIGHT, J. RIVERA, PAULIN, JAFFEE,
         ABBATE -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of A. FINCH, MAISEL, McENENY, SWEE-
         NEY -- read once and referred to the Committee on Aging

       AN ACT to amend the elder law, in relation to consumer directed personal
         assistance services

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 214 of the elder law is amended  by  adding  a  new
    2  subdivision 8 to read as follows:
    3    8.  CONSUMER  DIRECTED  PERSONAL  ASSISTANCE SERVICE PROVIDER. (A) ANY
    4  OTHER PROVISION OF ANY OTHER LAW TO THE  CONTRARY  NOTWITHSTANDING,  THE
    5  OFFICE  SHALL  BE  DEEMED  A  PARTICIPATING PROVIDER FOR THE PURPOSES OF
    6  PROVIDING CONSUMER DIRECTED PERSONAL  ASSISTANCE  SERVICES  PURSUANT  TO
    7  SECTION  THREE  HUNDRED  SIXTY-FIVE-F OF THE SOCIAL SERVICES LAW, EXCEPT
    8  THAT NOTWITHSTANDING ANY INCONSISTENT PROVISION OF  SUCH  SECTION  THREE
    9  HUNDRED  SIXTY-FIVE-F,  THE  TERM  "ELIGIBLE INDIVIDUAL" AS USED IN SUCH
   10  SECTION SHALL MEAN, FOR SERVICES  PROVIDED  BY  OR  THROUGH  THE  OFFICE
   11  PURSUANT  TO  THIS  SECTION, AN INDIVIDUAL AGED SIXTY OR OLDER WHO MEETS
   12  THE CRITERIA ESTABLISHED UNDER PARAGRAPH (A), (B) OR (C) OF  SUBDIVISION
   13  TWO  OF  SUCH  SECTION THREE HUNDRED SIXTY-FIVE-F, AND THE TERM "PARTIC-
   14  IPATING PROVIDER" AS USED IN SUCH SECTION, SHALL  WHEN  APPLIED  TO  THE
   15  OFFICE  PURSUANT  TO  THIS  SECTION  MEAN  AND  INCLUDE  THE OFFICE, ITS
   16  CONTRACTORS, AND ANY  INTERMEDIARY  SERVICE  ORGANIZATION,  WHETHER  THE
   17  RESPONSIBILITIES  OF  SUCH ORGANIZATION ARE PROVIDED BY THE OFFICE OR BY
   18  AN ENTITY OR ENTITIES CONTRACTED TO PERFORM SUCH  RESPONSIBILITIES  WITH
   19  THE OFFICE AND/OR ITS CONTRACTORS, IN THE FOLLOWING MODELS OR ANY COMBI-
   20  NATION THEREOF.  THE OFFICE SHALL DEVELOP A PARTICIPATING PROVIDER MODEL
   21  OR  MODELS  FOR THE PROVISION OF SERVICE WHICH ALLOW FOR A FULL RANGE OF
   22  FISCAL, SUPPORTIVE AND INTERMEDIARY SERVICES TO BE MADE AVAILABLE TO  AN
   23  ELIGIBLE  INDIVIDUAL  IN  A MANNER THAT CREATES A SEAMLESS FINANCING AND
   24  SERVICE DELIVERY SYSTEM. SERVICES TO BE PROVIDED SHALL INCLUDE  BUT  ARE

                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD04454-01-1

       A. 1701                             2

    1  NOT  LIMITED  TO  SERVICE  ASSESSMENT AND/OR CASE MANAGEMENT AND SERVICE
    2  MONITORING; PEER COUNSELING AND SUPPORT; ACCESS TO  EMPLOYER  MANAGEMENT
    3  SKILLS  TRAINING;  ACCESS  TO  TECHNICAL SKILLS TRAINING FOR ATTENDANTS;
    4  ACCESS  TO  TRAINING REGARDING EMPLOYER-RELATED FISCAL SKILLS; ACCESS TO
    5  CRIMINAL AND CERTIFICATION (E.G., NURSE AID REGISTRY) CHECKS; ACCESS  TO
    6  AN   ATTENDANT  REGISTRY;  AND  ACCESS  TO  EMERGENCY/BACK-UP  ATTENDANT
    7  SERVICES. THE OFFICE OR AN AGENCY CONTRACTED TO  IT  MAY  SERVE  AS  THE
    8  EMPLOYER  OF RECORD OF AN ATTENDANT, WITH THE ELIGIBLE INDIVIDUAL AS THE
    9  MANAGING EMPLOYER, AND MAY ALLOW THE  ELIGIBLE  INDIVIDUAL  TO  RECRUIT,
   10  TRAIN, SUPERVISE AND DISCHARGE HIS OR HER OWN ATTENDANT WHILE THE AGENCY
   11  ACTS  AS FISCAL AGENT AND RESOURCE FOR SUPPORTIVE ASSISTANCE, AS NEEDED.
   12  THE MODEL OR MODELS MAY ALSO  PROVIDE  FOR  PARTICIPATING  PROVIDERS  TO
   13  ADMINISTER AND DISBURSE CASH GRANT OR VOUCHER PROGRAMS ALLOWING ELIGIBLE
   14  INDIVIDUALS  TO  RECEIVE FUNDS INCLUDING PUBLIC FUNDS AND PAY ATTENDANTS
   15  DIRECTLY, AND PERFORM OTHER RELATED ADMINISTRATIVE TASKS  INCLUDING  BUT
   16  NOT  LIMITED TO THE COLLECTION AND VERIFICATION OF ATTENDANTS TIMESHEETS
   17  AND THE SUBMISSION OF INVOICES NECESSARY TO OBTAIN FUNDS  FOR  DISBURSE-
   18  MENT.  OTHER  SERVICES  WHICH  MAY  BE PROVIDED INCLUDE BUT SHALL NOT BE
   19  LIMITED TO CONDUCTING SELF-DIRECTION EVALUATIONS  OF  ELIGIBLE  INDIVID-
   20  UALS,  PROVIDING  EMPLOYER  SKILLS AND SELF-ADVOCACY TRAINING, ASSISTING
   21  ELIGIBLE INDIVIDUALS WITH  THE  RECRUITMENT,  SCREENING  AND  HIRING  OF
   22  ATTENDANTS  INCLUDING  CONDUCTING  BACKGROUND  CHECKS AND MAINTAINING AN
   23  ATTENDANT REGISTRY, AND ARRANGING FOR EMERGENCY/BACK-UP ATTENDANT STAFF,
   24  DETERMINING AND REASSESSING  ELIGIBLE  INDIVIDUALS  SERVICE  NEEDS,  AND
   25  PROVIDING  OR  ARRANGING FOR TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES FOR ATTENDANTS. SUCH
   26  SUPPORTIVE SERVICES MAY ALSO INCLUDE THE PROVISION  OF  CASE  MANAGEMENT
   27  AND  MONITORING THE QUALITY OF SERVICES PROVIDED AND ELIGIBLE INDIVIDUAL
   28  AND ATTENDANT SATISFACTION. THE OFFICE MAY INCLUDE  IN  DEVELOPING  SUCH
   29  MODEL  OR MODELS ANY COUNTY OR COUNTY AGENCY FOR THE AGING WITH WHICH IT
   30  SHALL PARTNER OR CONTRACT AND WHICH IS  APPROVED  PURSUANT  TO  INTERNAL
   31  REVENUE  SERVICE REVENUE PROCEDURE 80-4 OR REVENUE PROCEDURE 70-6 OR ANY
   32  SUCCESSOR THERETO TO BE THE EMPLOYER AGENT ON BEHALF OF  ELIGIBLE  INDI-
   33  VIDUALS  OR  TO ACT AS THE ELIGIBLE INDIVIDUAL'S FISCAL INTERMEDIARY FOR
   34  CERTAIN APPROVED SERVICES.
   35    (B) THE OFFICE SHALL FILE OR CAUSE TO  BE  FILED  WITHIN  ONE  HUNDRED
   36  TWENTY DAYS OF THE EFFECTIVE DATE OF THIS SUBDIVISION AN APPLICATION FOR
   37  A  FEDERAL WAIVER PURSUANT TO SECTION 1115 OF THE SOCIAL SECURITY ACT OR
   38  ANY SUCCESSOR THERETO, AND EVERY STATE AGENCY IS  HEREBY  EMPOWERED  AND
   39  DIRECTED TO COOPERATE WITH THE OFFICE AND TO COMPLY WITH ANY REQUEST FOR
   40  THE  FILING  OF SUCH WAIVER IF THE OFFICE SHALL LACK POWER AND AUTHORITY
   41  TO FILE SUCH WAIVER ITSELF. IN MAKING SUCH APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL WAIV-
   42  ER, THE OFFICE SHALL SEEK TO INCLUDE AND PROVIDE A SEAMLESS  NETWORK  OF
   43  OTHER SERVICES PROVIDED THROUGH THE OFFICE WHERE APPROPRIATE.  IN FILING
   44  SUCH  WAIVER  FOR THE OPERATION OF THE PROGRAM, THE OFFICE SHALL SEEK TO
   45  PROVIDE SERVICES PURSUANT TO THE PRINCIPLE  THAT  INDIVIDUALS  HAVE  THE
   46  PRIMARY AUTHORITY TO MAKE CHOICES THAT WORK BEST FOR THEM, REGARDLESS OF
   47  THE  NATURE  OR  EXTENT OF THEIR DISABILITY OR THE SOURCE OF PAYMENT FOR
   48  SERVICES. SERVICES PROVIDED PURSUANT TO THIS SECTION BY OR  THROUGH  THE
   49  OFFICE SHALL OBSERVE THE FOLLOWING OBJECTIVES AND ASSUMPTIONS:
   50    (1) THAT ELIGIBLE INDIVIDUALS ARE THE EXPERTS ON THEIR SERVICE NEEDS;
   51    (2)  THAT  DIFFERENT  TYPES  OF  SERVICES  WARRANT DIFFERENT LEVELS OF
   52  PROFESSIONAL INVOLVEMENT;
   53    (3) THAT CHOICE AND CONTROL CAN BE INTRODUCED INTO ALL SERVICE  DELIV-
   54  ERY ENVIRONMENTS;
   55    (4) THAT SERVICES THAT SUPPORT THE DIGNITY OF PEOPLE CAN BE LESS COST-
   56  LY WHEN PROPERLY DESIGNED; AND

       A. 1701                             3

    1    (5) THAT THE PROGRAM SHALL BE AVAILABLE TO ALL PERSONS OVER THE AGE OF
    2  SIXTY  WHO  MEET ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS, REGARDLESS OF PAYER OR SOURCE
    3  OF PAYMENT.
    4    (C)  IN  DESIGNING  THE  PROGRAM AND PROVIDING SERVICES, THE OFFICE IS
    5  AUTHORIZED TO WAIVE ANY PROVISION OF SECTION THREE HUNDRED SIXTY-SEVEN-B
    6  OF THE SOCIAL SERVICES LAW, OR ANY RULE OR REGULATION PROMULGATED PURSU-
    7  ANT TO SECTION THREE HUNDRED SIXTY-FIVE-F OF  THE  SOCIAL  SERVICES  LAW
    8  WHICH  IN  THE  JUDGMENT  OF THE OFFICE RESTRICTS ITS ABILITY TO PROVIDE
    9  SERVICES AS REQUIRED BY THIS SUBDIVISION, SO  LONG  AS  SUCH  WAIVER  IS
   10  CONSISTENT  WITH  ANY FEDERAL WAIVER GRANTED PURSUANT TO SECTION 1115 OF
   11  THE SOCIAL SECURITY ACT OR ANY SUCCESSOR THERETO.
   12    (D) THE OFFICE SHALL SEEK TO EXPAND SOURCE OF PAYMENT FOR THE PROGRAM,
   13  INCLUDING PAYMENTS FROM VOLUNTARY AND WILLING PRIVATE SOURCES, INSURANCE
   14  PLANS, CHARITIES AND FOUNDATIONS AND INDIVIDUALS.
   15    (E) THE OFFICE IS HEREBY EMPOWERED TO  PROVIDE  OR  CONTRACT  FOR  THE
   16  PROVISION  OF  SUCH  CONSUMER DIRECTED SERVICES IN ANY COUNTY WITHIN THE
   17  STATE. THE OFFICE SHALL SEEK TO COORDINATE  SERVICES  WITH  ANY  CURRENT
   18  PROVIDER  OF  CONSUMER DIRECTED SERVICES. NO STATE AGENCY SHALL IMPOSE A
   19  LIMITATION ON THE NUMBER OF ELIGIBLE INDIVIDUALS SERVED BY THIS PROGRAM.
   20    (F) THE OFFICE SHALL NOT BE SUBJECT TO AUDIT, ASSESSMENT,  SUSPENSION,
   21  SANCTION,  OR  REPORT BY A STATE AGENCY FOR A PROGRAM CONDUCTED PURSUANT
   22  TO THE AUTHORITY OF THIS SUBDIVISION, EXCEPT THAT IT SHALL BE SUBJECT TO
   23  AUDIT BY THE OFFICE OF THE STATE COMPTROLLER TO  THE  EXTENT  THAT  SUCH
   24  PROGRAMS WOULD HAVE BEEN SUBJECT TO AUDIT BUT FOR THIS PARAGRAPH.
   25    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the elder law, in relation to consumer directed personal assistance services
